info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 2:49PM CDT until June 10 at 3:35PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The Cimarron River valley in Payne County is covered by flood depths averaging 3 feet... with hazardous currents. Agricultural lands... oil wells... and water wells located near the river banks are inundated or cut off... several hours before and after the crest passes Ripley.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 19.8 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
